result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter S. SPENCER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hunter S. SPENCER

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Minutes.
Court amends Count 2 to Misdemeanor Joy Riding, contrary to Section 943.23(4m) of the Wisconsin Statutes on parties' joint agreement.
Rights explained.  Guilty plea.  Convicted.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.
Court sentences defendant to six months in the Manitowoc County Jail, Huber Law commencing 12/18/14 by 8:00 a.m.  Defendant is ordered to pay $443.00 costs of the action.  $443.00 cash bail to be applied and balance of $507.00 bail on file to be moved to 14CF422.

Plea Hearing scheduled for 11-18-2014 @ 11:00 a.m. BR-3.
Rescheduled from 10-16-2014.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 09-30-14 @ 11:30 am
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-28-14 at 11:30 a.m.  Plea date is set for 10-16-14 at 2:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

$400.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.
Bench warrant served.

Defendant in custody on bench warrant.  
The matter is continued for preliminary hearing on 08-07-14 at 9:00 a.m.  Court sets additional cash bail for $400.00.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.   
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.

Defendant failed to appear for a preliminary hearing.
Court authorizes warrant.
State moves to forfeit bail.  Court orders that cash bail be forfeitued immediately.
(defendant was arrested on this warrant later in the morning and will be having a bail hearing.  Per Judge Fox, do not forfeit the bail.)

$50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

Additional cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.

Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 07-07-14 at 10:00 a.m.   
Minutes.
Anthony Lambrecht, Public Defender.
RE:  Pedestrians, on 06-12-14.
At 9:15 a.m., $500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2nd degree reckless endangerment, obstruct officer and fleeing an officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-23-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that he not operate a motor vehicle.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
